alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 10:28PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Cache and northwestern Rich Counties through 1115 PM MDT... At 1028 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lewiston to near Wellsville. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Cache, Smithfield, Hyrum, Wellsville, Lewiston, Trenton, Utah State University, Benson, Peter, Garden, North Logan, Providence, Nibley, Hyde Park, Richmond, Millville, River Heights, Mendon and Amalga. This includes US Route 89 between mile markers 459 and 492. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
